alkalinity_measurement_unit: milligram per liter of calcium carbonate (mg/L CaCO3)
diagnostic_measurement_method: digital real time polymerase chain reaction (dPCR)
quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction (qPCR)
diagnostic_measurement_unit: colony forming units per 100 milliliter (CFU/100 mL)
colony forming units per grams total solids (CFU/gTS)
most probable number per 100 milliliter (MPN/100 mL)
fecal_coliform_count_unit: colony forming units per 100 milliliter (CFU/100 mL)
colony forming units per grams total solids (CFU/gTS)
most probable number per 100 milliliter (MPN/100 mL)
fecal_contamination_unit: log10 gene copies per 100 milliliter (log10 GC/100 mL)
log10 gene copies per nanogram total DNA
geo_loc_name_country: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
quality_control_determination: sequence flagged for potential quality control issues
total_phosphorus_TP_measurement_unit: milligrams orthophosphate as phosphorus per liter (mg PO4-P/L)
orthophosphate as phosphorus per total solids (gPO4-P/gTS)
water_catchment_area_human_population_de: persons per square mile (?? / sq mi)

schemas.description: The collection of data elements based on pha4ge's Wastewater Contextual Data Specification.

fields.description: The filename of the report containing the results of an in silico antimicrobial resistance analysis.

meta.notes: Provide the filename of the report containing the results of the AMR analysis.

fields.name: AMR analysis report filename

fields.description: The name of the software used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant identification/analysis.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the software used for AMR analysis.

fields.name: AMR analysis software name

fields.description: The version number of the software used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant idenrtification/analysis.

meta.notes: Provide the version number of the software used for AMR analysis.

fields.name: AMR analysis software version

fields.description: Thr name of the reference database used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant identification/analysis.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the reference database used for AMR analysis.

fields.name: AMR reference database name

fields.description: The version number of the reference database used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant identification/analysis.

meta.notes: Provide the version number of the reference database used for AMR analysis.

fields.name: AMR reference database version

fields.description: The INSDC (i.e., ENA, NCBI, or DDBJ) accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.

meta.notes: Store the BioProject accession number. BioProjects are an organizing tool that links together raw sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. Each province will be assigned a different bioproject accession number by the National Microbiology Lab. A valid NCBI BioProject accession has prefix PRJN e.g., PRJNA12345, and is created once at the beginning of a new sequencing project.

fields.name: BioProject accession

fields.description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in INSDC (i.e., ENA, NCBI, or DDBJ) archives.

meta.notes: Store the accession returned from the BioSample submission. NCBI BioSamples will have the prefix SAMN.

fields.name: BioSample accession

fields.description: The length of the DNA fragment generated by mechanical shearing or enzymatic digestion for the purposes of library preparation.

meta.notes: Provide the fragment length in base pairs (do not include the units).

fields.name: DNA fragment length

fields.description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in DRA (DDBJ Sequence Read Archive) archives.

meta.notes: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. DRA accessions start with DRA.

fields.name: DRA accession

fields.description: The DataHarmonizer software and template version provenance.

meta.notes: The current software and template version information will be automatically generated in this field after the user utilizes the "validate" function. This information will be generated regardless as to whether the row is valid of not.

fields.name: DataHarmonizer provenance

fields.description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in ENA (European Nucleotide Archive) archives.

meta.notes: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. ENA accessions start with SAMEA.

fields.name: ENA accession

fields.description: The identifier assigned to a sequence in Enterobase archives.

meta.notes: Store the barcode assigned to the submitted sequence. Enterobase barcodes start with different 3 letter codes depending on the organism.

fields.name: Enterobase accession

fields.description: The identifier assigned to a sequence in GISAID (the Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data) archives.

meta.notes: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. GISAID accessions start with EPI.

fields.name: GISAID accession

fields.description: The user-defined GISAID virus name assigned to the sequence.

meta.notes: GISAID virus names should be in the format "hCoV-19/Country/Identifier/year".

fields.name: GISAID virus name

fields.description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in GSA (Genome Sequence Archive) archives.

meta.notes: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. GSA accessions start with CRA.

fields.name: GSA accession

fields.description: The versioned identifier assigned to an assembly or consensus sequence in GenBank archives.

meta.notes: Store the versioned GenBank accession assigned to the submitted sequence.

fields.name: GenBank accession (versioned)

fields.description: The length of the shortest read that, together with other reads, represents at least 50% of the nucleotides in a set of sequences.

meta.notes: Provide the N50 value in Mb.

fields.name: N50

fields.description: The number of ambiguous bases (Ns) normalized per 100 kilobasepairs (kbp).

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: Ns per 100 kbp

fields.description: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the INSDC.

meta.notes: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. NCBI-SRA accessions start with SRR.

fields.name: SRA accession

fields.description: The process used to measure alkalinity.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure alkalinity.

fields.name: alkalinity measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of alkalinity.

meta.examples: milligram per liter of calcium carbonate (mg/L CaCO3)
meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured alkalinity.

fields.name: alkalinity measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of alkalinity.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured alkalinity.

fields.name: alkalinity measurement value

fields.description: An alternative isolate_ID assigned to the isolate by another organization.

meta.notes: Alternative isolate IDs should be provided in the in a prescribed format which consists of the ID followed by square brackets (no space in between the ID and bracket) containing the short form of ID provider‚Äôs agency name i.e. ID[short organization code]. An example of a properly formatted alternative_isolate_identifier would be e.g. XYZ4567[CFIA]. Multiple alternative isolate IDs can be provided, separated by semi-colons.

fields.name: alternative isolate ID

fields.description: The units of a measurement of the ambient temperature.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured temperature.

fields.name: ambient temperature measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of the ambient temperature.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured temperature.

fields.name: ambient temperature measurement value

fields.description: The specifications of the primers (primer sequences, binding positions, fragment size generated etc) used to generate the amplicons to be sequenced.

meta.notes: Provide the name and version of the primer scheme used to generate the amplicons for sequencing.

fields.name: amplicon pcr primer scheme

fields.description: The length of the amplicon generated by PCR amplification.

meta.notes: Provide the amplicon size, including the units.

fields.name: amplicon size

fields.description: Names of individuals contributing to the processes of sample collection, sequence generation, analysis, and data submission.

meta.examples: Tejinder Singh, Fei Hu, Joe Blogs
meta.notes: Include the first and last names of all individuals that should be attributed, separated by a comma.

fields.name: authors

fields.description: A description of the overall bioinformatics strategy used.

meta.notes: Further details regarding the methods used to process raw data, and/or generate assemblies, and/or generate consensus sequences can. This information can be provided in an SOP or protocol or pipeline/workflow. Provide the name and version number of the protocol, or a GitHub link to a pipeline or workflow.

fields.name: bioinformatics protocol

fields.description: The percentage of the reference genome covered by the sequenced data, to a prescribed depth.

meta.notes: Provide value as a percent.

fields.name: breadth of coverage value

fields.description: The method used to measure carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD).

meta.displayName: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement method
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure CBOD.

fields.name: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement method

fields: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement unit
carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement value

fields.description: The units of a measurement of carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD).

meta.displayName: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement unit
meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured CBOD by selecting a value from the pick list.

fields.name: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement unit

fields: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement method
carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement value

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD).

meta.displayName: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement value
meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured CBOD.

fields.name: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement value

fields: carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement unit
carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand (CBOD) measurement method

fields.description: The method used to measure chemical oxygen demand (COD).

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure COD.

fields.name: chemical oxygen demand (COD) measurement method

fields.description: The units associated with a value from a chemical oxygen demand (COD) test.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the COD test result.

fields.name: chemical oxygen demand (COD) measurement unit

fields.description: The measured value from a chemical oxygen demand (COD) test.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the COD test result.

fields.name: chemical oxygen demand (COD) measurement value

fields.description: The instrument or container used to collect the sample e.g. grab sampler.

meta.notes: Provide a descriptor if a device was used for sampling. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

fields.name: collection device

fields.description: An environmental location may describe a site in the natural or built environment e.g. contact surface, metal can, hospital, wet market, bat cave.

meta.notes: Provide a descriptor of the environmental site sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

fields.name: collection method

fields.description: The method used to measure conductivity.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure conductivity.

fields.name: conductivity measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of conductivity.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured conductivity.

fields.name: conductivity measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of conductivity.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured conductivity.

fields.name: conductivity measurement value

fields.description: The length of the genome defined by the most common nucleotides at each position.

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: consensus genome length

fields.description: The name of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

fields.name: consensus sequence software name

fields.description: The version of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

meta.notes: Provide the version of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

fields.name: consensus sequence software version

fields.description: The method used to remove duplicated reads in a sequence read dataset.

meta.notes: Provide the deduplication software name followed by the version, or a link to a tool or method.

fields.name: deduplication method

fields.description: The method used to remove host reads from the pathogen sequence.

meta.notes: Provide the name and version number of the software used to remove host reads.

fields.name: dehosting method

fields.description: The threshold used as a cut-off for the depth of coverage.

meta.notes: Provide the threshold fold coverage.

fields.name: depth of coverage threshold

fields.description: The average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.

meta.notes: Provide value as a fold of coverage.

fields.name: depth of coverage value

fields.description: The method by which a diagnostic result was received.

meta.notes: Select a value from the pick list provided to describe the method used for a given diagnostic test.

fields.name: diagnostic measurement method

fields.description: The method by which a diagnostic result was received.

meta.notes: Select a value from the pick list provided to describe the method used for a given diagnostic test.

fields.name: diagnostic measurement unit

fields.description: The unit of the result from a diagnostic test.

meta.notes: Select a value from the pick list provided, to describe the units of the given diagnostic test.

fields.name: diagnostic measurement value

fields.description: The value of the result from a diagnostic test.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical result of a diagnostic test (no need to include units).

fields.name: diagnostic target presence

fields.description: The method used to measure dissolved oxygen.

meta.examples: Dissolved oxygen meter in vertical direction
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure dissolved oxygen.

fields.name: dissolved oxygen measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of dissolved oxygen.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured dissolved oxygen by selecting a value from the pick list.

fields.name: dissolved oxygen measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of dissolved oxygen.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured dissolved oxygen.

fields.name: dissolved oxygen measurement value

fields.description: The description of the endogenous controls included when extracting a sample.

meta.notes: Provide the names of endogenous controls that were used as a reference during extraction. If relevant, include titers of these controls, as well as whether any controls were expected but not identified in the sample.

fields.name: endogenous control details

fields.description: A substance obtained from the natural or man-made environment e.g. soil, water, sewage.

meta.notes: Provide a descriptor of the environmental material sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

fields.name: environmental material

fields.description: The properties, characteristics and qualities of a substance obtained from the natural or man-made environment.

meta.notes: Provide the environmental material properties by selecting descriptors from the pick list.

fields.name: environmental material properties

fields.description: An environmental location may describe a site in the natural or built environment e.g. contact surface, metal can, hospital, wet market, bat cave.

meta.notes: Provide a descriptor of the environmental site sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

fields.name: environmental site

fields.description: The details regarding the experimental control contained in the sample.

meta.examples: Human coronavirus 229E (HCoV-229E) spiked in sample as process control
meta.notes: Provide details regarding the nature of the reference strain used as a control, or what is was used to monitor.

fields.name: experimental control details

fields.description: The name of the overarching experimental methodology that was used to process the biomaterial.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the methodology used in your study. If available, provide a link to the protocol.

fields.name: experimental protocol field

fields.description: The type of role that the sample represents in the experiment.

meta.notes: Samples can play different types of roles in experiments. A sample under study in one experiment may act as a control or be a replicate of another sample in another experiment. This field is used to distinguish samples under study from controls, replicates, etc.  If the sample acted as an experimental control or a replicate, select a role type from the picklist. If the sample was not a control, leave blank or select "Not Applicable".

fields.name: experimental specimen role type

fields.description: The method by which recovery efficiency of an extraction was calculated.

meta.notes: Provide a brief description of how extraction recovery efficiency was measured or estimated.

fields.name: extraction recovery efficiency measurement method

fields.description: The recovery efficiency of an extraction, calculated as the amount of a synthetic or endogenous compound identified in the sample relative to the amount expected.

meta.notes: Provide value as a percent.

fields.name: extraction recovery efficiency measurement value

fields.description: The method used to measure fecal coliforms.

meta.examples: MPN method via serial dilutions until lack of growth
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure fecal coliforms.

fields.name: fecal coliform count method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of fecal coliforms.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured fecal coliforms.

fields.name: fecal coliform count unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of fecal coliforms within a sample.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured fecal coliforms.

fields.name: fecal coliform count value

fields.description: A gene, virus, bacteria, or substance used to measure the sanitary quality of water in regards to fecal contamination.

meta.notes: If a fecal contamination indicator was measured, select it from the picklist.

fields.name: fecal contamination indicator

fields.description: The method used to measure fecal contamination.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure fecal contamination.

fields.name: fecal contamination method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of fecal contamination.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured fecal contamination.

fields.name: fecal contamination unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of fecal contamination.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured fecal contamination.

fields.name: fecal contamination value

fields.description: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.

meta.notes: Provide the full name of the gene used in the test. The gene symbol (short form of gene name) can also be provided. Standardized gene names and symbols can be found in the Gene Ontology using this look-up service: https://bit.ly/2Sq1LbI

fields.name: gene name

fields.description: The percentage of expected genes identified in the genome being sequenced. Missing genes indicate missing genomic regions (incompleteness) in the data.

meta.notes: Provide the genome completeness as a percent (no need to include units).

fields.name: genome completeness

fields.description: The molecular technique used to selectively capture and amplify specific regions of interest from a genome.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the enrichment method

fields.name: genomic target enrichment method

fields.description: Details that provide additional context to the molecular technique used to selectively capture and amplify specific regions of interest from a genome.

meta.examples: enrichment was done using Twist's respiratory virus research panel: https://www.twistbioscience.com/products/ngs/fixed-panels/respiratory-virus-research-panel
meta.notes: Provide details that are applicable to the method you used.

fields.name: genomic target enrichment method details

fields.description: The latitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.

meta.notes: Provide latitude coordinates if available. Do not use the centre of the city/region/province/state/country or the location of your agency as a proxy, as this implicates a real location and is misleading. Specify as degrees latitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S".

fields.name: geo loc latitude

fields.description: The longitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.

meta.notes: Provide longitude coordinates if available. Do not use the centre of the city/region/province/state/country or the location of your agency as a proxy, as this implicates a real location and is misleading. Specify as degrees longitude in format "d[dd.dddd] W|E".

fields.name: geo loc longitude

fields.description: The city of origin of the sample.

meta.notes: Provide the city name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

fields.name: geo loc name (city)

fields.description: The country of origin of the sample.

meta.notes: If known, select a value from the pick list.

fields.name: geo loc name (country)

fields.description: The county/region of origin of the sample.

meta.notes: Provide the county/region name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

fields.name: geo loc name (county/region)

fields.description: The name of a specific geographical location e.g. Credit River (rather than river).

meta.notes: Provide the name of the specific geographical site using a specific noun (a word that names a certain place, thing).

fields.name: geo loc name (site)

fields.description: The state/province/territory of origin of the sample.

meta.notes: Provide the state/province/territory name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/ga

fields.name: geo loc name (state/province/territory)

fields.description: The process used to measure instantaneous fluid flow rate.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure flow rate.

fields.name: instantaneous flow rate measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measured instantaneous fluid flow rate.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured flow rate by selecting a value from the pick list.

fields.name: instantaneous flow rate measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measured instantaneous fluid flow rate.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured flow rate.

fields.name: instantaneous flow rate measurement value

fields.description: The user-defined identifier for the isolate, as provided by the laboratory that originally isolated the isolate.

meta.notes: Provide the isolate_ID created by the lab that first isolated the isolate (i.e. the original isolate ID). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value. If only an alternate isolate ID is known (e.g. the ID from your lab, if your lab did not isolate the isolate from the original sample), make asure to include it in the alternative_isolate_ID field.

fields.name: isolate ID

fields.description: The date on which the isolate was received by the laboratory.

meta.notes: Provide the date according to the ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY".

fields.name: isolate received date

fields.description: The name of the agency, organization or institution with which the individual who performed the isolation procedure is affiliated.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the agency, organization or institution that isolated the original isolate in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: isolated by

fields.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the isolate.

meta.notes: Provide the email associated with the listed contact. As personnel turnover may render an individual's email obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide an address for a position or lab, to ensure accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: isolated by contact email

fields.description: The name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the isolate.

meta.notes: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: isolated by contact name

fields.description: The specific laboratory affiliation of the individual who performed the isolation procedure.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that that isolated the original isolate (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: isolated by laboratory name

fields.description: The date on which the isolate was isolated from a sample.

meta.notes: Provide the date according to the ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY".

fields.name: isolation date

fields.description: The user-specified identifier for the library prepared for sequencing.

meta.notes: The library name should be unique, and can be an autogenerated ID from your LIMS, or modification of the isolate ID.

fields.name: library ID

fields.description: The name of the DNA library preparation kit used to generate the library being sequenced.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the library preparation kit used.

fields.name: library preparation kit

fields.description: The filename of the report containing the results of a lineage/clade analysis.

meta.notes: Provide the filename of the report containing the results of the lineage/clade analysis.

fields.name: lineage/clade analysis report filename

fields.description: The name of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.

fields.name: lineage/clade analysis software name

fields.description: The version of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.

meta.notes: Provide the version of the software used ot determine the lineage/clade.

fields.name: lineage/clade analysis software version

fields.description: The name of the lineage or clade.

meta.notes: Provide the Pangolin or Nextstrain lineage/clade name. Multiple lineages/clades can be provided, separated by a semicolon.

fields.name: lineage/clade name

fields.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a genome reconstructed from metagenomic data.

meta.notes: Store the MAG ID.

fields.name: metagenome-assembled genome (MAG) ID

fields.description: The laboratory method used to grow, prepare, and/or isolate the microbial isolate.

meta.notes: Provide the name and version number of the microbiological method. The ID of the method is also acceptable if the ID can be linked to the laboratory that created the procedure.

fields.name: microbiological method

fields.description: The threshold used as a cut-off for the minimum length of a read after trimming.

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: minimum post-trimming read length

fields.description: The kit used to extract genomic material from a sample

meta.notes: Provide the name of the genomic extraction kit used.

fields.name: nucleic acid extraction kit

fields.description: The process used to extract genomic material from a sample.

meta.notes: Briefly describe the extraction method used.

fields.name: nucleic acid extraction method

fields.description: The number of total base pairs generated by the sequencing process.

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: number of base pairs sequenced

fields.description: The number of contigs (contiguous sequences) in a sequence assembly.

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value.

fields.name: number of contigs

fields.description: The total number of non-unique reads generated by the sequencing process.

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: number of total reads

fields.description: The number of unique reads generated by the sequencing process.

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: number of unique reads

fields.description: Taxonomic name of the organism.

meta.notes: Provide the official nomenclature for the organism present in the sample. Search for taxonomic names here: ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.

fields.name: organism

fields.description: The method used to measure oxygen reduction potential (ORP).

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure oxygen reduction potential.

fields.name: oxygen reduction potential (ORP) measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of oxygen reduction potential (ORP).

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured oxygen reduction potential by selecting a value from the pick list.

fields.name: oxygen reduction potential (ORP) measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of oxygen reduction potential (ORP).

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured oxygen reduction potential.

fields.name: oxygen reduction potential (ORP) measurement value

fields.description: The process used to measure pH value.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure pH.

fields.name: pH measurement method

fields.description: The measured pH value indicating the acidity or basicity(alkalinity) of an aqueous solution.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured pH.

fields.name: pH measurement value

fields.description: The percentage of the assembly that consists of ambiguous bases (Ns).

meta.displayName: percent Ns across total genome length
meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: percent Ns across total genome length

fields.description: The percent of the total number of reads identified as contamination (not belonging to the target organism) in a sequence dataset.

meta.notes: Provide the percent contamination value (no need to include units).

fields.name: percent read contamination

fields.description: The phagetype of the organism.

meta.notes: Provide if known. If unknown, put ‚Äúmissing‚Äù.

fields.name: phagetype

fields.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a combined (pooled) set of samples.

meta.notes: If the sample being analyzed is the result of pooling individual samples, rename the pooled sample with a new identifier. Store the pooled sample ID.

fields.name: pooled sample ID

fields.description: A type of area that is populated by humans to different degrees.

meta.notes: Provide the populated area type from the pick list.

fields.name: populated area type

fields.description: The process used to measure the amount of water which has fallen during a precipitation process.

meta.examples: Rain gauge over a 12 hour period prior to sample collection
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or method used to measure precipitation.

fields.name: precipitation measurement method

fields.description: The units of measurement for the amount of water which has fallen during a precipitation process.

meta.notes: Provide the units of precipitation by selecting a value from the pick list.

fields.name: precipitation measurement unit

fields.description: The amount of water which has fallen during a precipitation process.

meta.notes: Provide the quantity of precipitation in the area leading up to the time of sample collection.

fields.name: precipitation measurement value

fields.description: The activities or variables upstream of sample collection that may affect the sample.

meta.notes: If there was an activity that would affect the sample prior to collection (this is different than sample processing), provide the activities by selecting one or more values from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: presampling activity

fields.description: The details of the activities or variables that affected the sample collected.

meta.examples: Agricultural waste from large farm contributes waste to the site sampled.
meta.notes: Briefly describe the presampling activities using free text.

fields.name: presampling activity details

fields.description: Weather conditions prior to collection that may affect the sample.

meta.notes: Provide the weather conditions prior to sample collection.

fields.name: presampling weather conditions

fields.description: The identifier assigned to a progenitor isolate derived from an isolate that was directly obtained from a sample.

meta.notes: If your sequence data pertains to progeny of an original isolate, provide the progeny_isolate_ID.

fields.name: progeny isolate ID

fields.description: The reason that the sample was collected.

meta.notes: The reason a sample was collected may provide information about potential biases in sampling strategy. Provide the purpose of sampling from the picklist in the template. Most likely, the sample was collected for Public health surveillance. The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing, which should be indicated in the "purpose of sequencing" field.

fields.name: purpose of sampling

fields.description: The reason that the sample was sequenced.

meta.notes: The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing. The reason a sample was sequenced may provide information about potential biases in sequencing strategy. Provide the purpose of sequencing from the picklist in the template. The reason for sample collection should be indicated in the "purpose of sampling" field.

fields.name: purpose of sequencing

fields.description: The description of why the sample was sequenced providing specific details.

meta.notes: Provide an expanded description of why the sample was sequenced using free text. The description may include the importance of the sequences for a particular public health investigation/surveillance activity/research question. Suggested standardized descriptions include: Assessing public health control measures, Determining early introductions and spread, Investigating airline-related exposures, Investigating remote regions, Investigating health care workers, Investigating schools/universities.

fields.name: purpose of sequencing details

fields.description: The details surrounding a low quality determination in a quality control assessment.

meta.examples: CT value of 39. Low viral load. Low DNA concentration after amplification.
meta.notes: Provide notes or details regarding QC results using free text.

fields.name: quality control details

fields.description: The determination of a quality control assessment.

meta.notes: Select a value from the pick list provided. If a desired value is missing, submit a new term request to the PHA4GE QC Tag GitHub issuetracker using the New Term Request form.

fields.name: quality control determination

fields.description: The reason contributing to, or causing, a low quality determination in a quality control assessment.

meta.notes: Select a value from the pick list provided. If a desired value is missing, submit a new term request to the PHA4GE QC Tag GitHub issuetracker using the New Term Request form.

fields.name: quality control issues

fields.description: The name of the method used to assess whether a sequence passed a predetermined quality control threshold.

meta.notes: Providing the name of the method used for quality control is very important for interpreting the rest of the QC information. Method names can be provided as the name of a pipeline or a link to a GitHub repository. Multiple methods should be listed and separated by a semi-colon. Do not include QC tags in other fields if no method name is provided.

fields.name: quality control method name

fields.description: The version number of the method used to assess whether a sequence passed a predetermined quality control threshold.

meta.notes: Methods updates can make big differences to their outputs. Provide the version of the method used for quality control. The version can be expressed using whatever convention the developer implements (e.g. date, semantic versioning). If multiple methods were used, record the version numbers in the same order as the method names. Separate the version numbers using a semi-colon.

fields.name: quality control method version

fields.description: The names of the software and version number used for raw data processing such as removing barcodes, adapter trimming, filtering etc.

meta.notes: Provide the software name followed by the version e.g. Trimmomatic v. 0.38, Porechop v. 0.2.3

fields.name: raw sequence data processing method

fields.description: A description of the criteria used to map reads to a reference sequence.

meta.notes: Provide a description of the read mapping criteria.

fields.name: read mapping criteria

fields.description: The name of the software used to map sequence reads to a reference genome or set of reference genes.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the read mapping software.

fields.name: read mapping software name

fields.description: The version of the software used to map sequence reads to a reference genome or set of reference genes.

meta.notes: Provide the version number of the read mapping software.

fields.name: read mapping software version

fields.description: A persistent, unique identifier of a genome database entry.

meta.notes: Provide the accession number of the reference genome.

fields.name: reference genome accession

fields.description: The method used to measure salinity.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure salinity.

fields.name: salinity measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of salinity.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured salinity.

fields.name: salinity measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of salinity.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured salinity.

fields.name: salinity measurement value

fields.description: The name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated.

meta.notes: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions.

fields.name: sample collected by

fields.description: Status indicating if sample collector was provided.

meta.notes: A conditional check where if value is provided then sample collected by is not required

fields.name: sample collected by null reason

fields.description: The name of the individual at the organization that collected the original sample that plays a data governance role and oversees how a sample and associated contextual data is used and distributed.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the sample collection data steward.

fields.name: sample collection data steward name

fields.description: The date on which the sample was collected.

meta.notes: Sample collection date is critical for surveillance and many types of analyses. Required granularity includes year, month and day. If this date is considered identifiable information, it is acceptable to add "jitter" by adding or subtracting a calendar day (acceptable by GISAID). Alternatively, ‚Äùreceived date‚Äù may be used as a substitute. The date should be provided in ISO 8601 standard format "YYYY-MM-DD".

fields.name: sample collection date

fields.description: Status indicating if sample collection date was provided.

meta.notes: A conditional check where if value is provided then sequenced by is not required

fields.name: sample collection date null reason

fields.description: The date on which sample collection ended for a continuous sample.

meta.notes: Provide the date that sample collection ended in ISO 8601 format i.e. YYYY-MM-DD

fields.name: sample collection end date

fields.description: The time at which sample collection ended.

meta.notes: Provide this time in ISO 8601 24hr format, in your local time.

fields.name: sample collection end time

fields.description: The time at which sample collection began.

meta.notes: Provide this time in ISO 8601 24hr format, in your local time.

fields.name: sample collection start time

fields.description: The units of the time duration measurement of sample collection.

meta.notes: Provide the units from the pick list.

fields.name: sample collection time duration unit

fields.description: The amount of time over which the sample was collected.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of time.

fields.name: sample collection time duration value

fields.description: The descriptive time of day during which the sample was collected.

meta.notes: If known, select a value from the pick list. The time of sample processing matters especially for grab samples, as fecal concentration in wastewater fluctuates over the course of the day.

fields.name: sample collection time of day

fields.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.

meta.notes: The email address can represent a specific individual or lab e.g. johnnyblogs@lab.ca, or RespLab@lab.ca

fields.name: sample collector contact email

fields.description: The date on which the sample was processed.

meta.notes: Provide the sample processed date in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD". The sample may be collected and processed (e.g. filtered, extraction) on the same day, or on different dates.

fields.name: sample processing date

fields.description: The date on which the sample was received.

meta.notes: Provide the sample received date in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD".

fields.name: sample received date

fields.description: The units of a measured sample storage duration.

meta.notes: Provide the units from the pick list.

fields.name: sample storage duration unit

fields.description: The numerical value of the time measurement during which a sample is in storage.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of time.

fields.name: sample storage duration value

fields.description: The medium in which a sample is stored.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the transport medium or storage medium used for this sample. If none was used, leave blank or write "None".

fields.name: sample storage medium

fields.description: The process used to store the sample.

meta.examples: The sample was placed in a tube in a cooler bag during transportation (~3 hours) to the lab site. At this point the sample was placed in storage medium and put in a -10C freezer until it was processed and extracted 5 days later.
meta.notes: Provide details of how the sample was stored from time of collection until time of processing. If there were issues with the cold chain storage, note those here.

fields.name: sample storage method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of temperature of a sample at the time of collection.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured temperature.

fields.name: sample temperature unit (at collection)

fields.description: The units of a measurement of temperature of a sample at the time upon receipt.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured temperature.

fields.name: sample temperature unit (when received)

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of temperature of a sample at collection.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured temperature.

fields.name: sample temperature value (at collection)

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of temperature of a sample upon receipt.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured temperature.

fields.name: sample temperature value (when received)

fields.description: The units of the volume measurement of the sample collected.

meta.notes: Provide the units from the pick list.

fields.name: sample volume measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of the volume measurement of the sample collected.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of volume.

fields.name: sample volume measurement value

fields.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a specific event during which one or more samples are taken, from one or more sites.

meta.notes: Store the ID for the event during which a sample or samples were taken. For example, an event could be one person taking samples from multiple sites, or multiple people taking samples from one site.

fields.name: sampling event ID

fields.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a specific location from which samples are taken.

meta.notes: Store the ID for the site from which a sample was taken. The "site" is user defined (e.g. it may be a building and its environs, a specific entity within an environment). Please use the same site ID for all samples from a given site, regardless of when these samples were taken. Any important changes in site location, should be represented with a new site ID.

fields.name: sampling site ID

fields.description: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.

meta.notes: Provide the weather conditions at the time of sample collection.

fields.name: sampling weather conditions

fields.description: The range of locations or entities sampled expressed in general terms.

meta.notes: Provide the scale of wastewater sampling by selecting a value from the picklist.

fields.name: scale of sampling

fields.description: The length of the genome generated by assembling reads using a scaffold or by reference-based mapping.

meta.notes: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

fields.name: sequence assembly length

fields.description: The name of the software used to assemble a sequence.

meta.examples: SPAdes Genome Assembler, Canu, wtdbg2, velvet
meta.notes: Provide the name of the software used to assemble the sequence.

fields.name: sequence assembly software name

fields.description: The version of the software used to assemble a sequence.

meta.notes: Provide the version of the software used to assemble the sequence.

fields.name: sequence assembly software version

fields.description: The name of the agency that submitted the sequence to a database.

meta.notes: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions. If submitting specimens rather than sequencing data, please put the "National Microbiology Laboratory (NML)".

fields.name: sequence submitted by

fields.description: Status indicating if sequence submitter was provided.

meta.notes: A conditional check where if value is provided then sequence submitted by is not required

fields.name: sequence submitted by null reason

fields.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.

meta.notes: The email address can represent a specific individual or laboratory.

fields.name: sequence submitter contact email

fields.description: The name of the agency that submitted the sequence to a database.

meta.notes: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions. If submitting specimens rather than sequencing data, please put the "National Microbiology Laboratory (NML)".

fields.name: sequenced by

fields.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.

meta.notes: The email address can represent a specific individual or laboratory.

fields.name: sequenced by contact email

fields.description: The name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.

meta.notes: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: sequenced by contact name

fields.description: Status indicating if sequencer was provided.

meta.notes: A conditional check where if value is provided then sequenced by is not required

fields.name: sequenced by null reason

fields.description: The overarching sequencing methodology that was used to determine the sequence of a biomaterial.

meta.notes: Example Guidance: Provide the name of the DNA or RNA sequencing technology used in your study. If unsure refer to the protocol documentation, or provide a null value.

fields.name: sequencing assay type

fields.description: The date the sample was sequenced.

meta.notes: ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD".

fields.name: sequencing date

fields.description: The model of the sequencing instrument used.

meta.notes: Provide the model sequencing instrument by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: sequencing instrument

fields.description: The platform technology used to perform the sequencing.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the company that created the sequencing instrument by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

fields.name: sequencing platform

fields.description: The protocol or method used for sequencing.

meta.notes: Provide the name and version of the procedure or protocol used for sequencing. You can also provide a link to a protocol online.

fields.name: sequencing protocol

fields.description: The method used to determine the serovar.

meta.notes: If the serovar was determined via traditional serotyping methods, put ‚ÄúTraditional serotyping‚Äù. If the serovar was determined via in silico methods, provide the name and version number of the software.

fields.name: serotyping method

fields.description: The serovar of the organism.

meta.notes: Only include this information if it has been determined by traditional serological methods or a validated in silico prediction tool e.g. SISTR.

fields.name: serovar

fields.description: The user-defined project name assigned to a sequencing project.

meta.notes: If the sample was collected or analyzed under the umbrella of a specific project, include the name of that project here.

fields.name: specimen collector project ID

fields.description: The user-defined name for the sample.

meta.notes: Store the collector sample ID. If this number is considered identifiable information, provide an alternative ID. Be sure to store the key that maps between the original and alternative IDs for traceability and follow up if necessary. Every collector sample ID from a single submitter must be unique. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab.

fields.name: specimen collector sample ID

fields.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a portion of the original sample.

meta.notes: Store the ID for the subsample/aliquot.

fields.name: specimen collector subsample ID

fields.description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after receiving the sample.

meta.notes: Select processes from the picklist that were applied to this sample.

fields.name: specimen processing

fields.description: The details of the processing applied to the sample during or after receiving the sample.

meta.notes: Briefly describe the processes applied to the sample.

fields.name: specimen processing details

fields.description: The strain identifier.

meta.notes: If the isolate represents or is derived from, a lab reference strain or strain from a type culture collection, provide the strain identifier.

fields.name: strain

fields.description: The date a taxonomic analysis was performed.

meta.notes: Providing the date that an analyis was performed can help provide context for tool and reference database versions. Provide the date that the taxonomic analysis was performed in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD".

fields.name: taxonomic analysis date

fields.description: The filename of the report containing the results of a taxonomic analysis.

meta.notes: Provide the filename of the report containing the results of the taxonomic analysis.

fields.name: taxonomic analysis report filename

fields.description: The name of the taxonomic reference database used to identify the organism.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the taxonomic reference database.

fields.name: taxonomic reference database name

fields.description: The version of the taxonomic reference database used to identify the organism.

meta.notes: Provide the version number of the taxonomic reference database.

fields.name: taxonomic reference database version

fields.description: The process used to measure total daily fluid flow rate.

meta.displayName: total daily flow rate measurement method
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure flow rate.

fields.name: total daily flow rate measurement method

fields: total daily flow rate measurement unit
total daily flow rate measurement value

fields.description: The units of a measured fluid flow rate over the course of a day.

meta.displayName: total daily flow rate measurement unit
meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured flow rate by selecting a value from the pick list.

fields.name: total daily flow rate measurement unit

fields: total daily flow rate measurement method
total daily flow rate measurement value

fields.description: The numerical value of a measured fluid flow rate over the course of a day.

meta.displayName: total daily flow rate measurement value
meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured flow rate.

fields.name: total daily flow rate measurement value

fields: total daily flow rate measurement method
total daily flow rate measurement unit

fields.description: The method used to measure total dissolved solids (TDS).

meta.examples: Subtract calculated TSS from calculated TS
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure TDS.

fields.name: total dissolved solids (TDS) measurement method

fields.description: The units associated with a value from a total dissolved solids (TDS) test.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured TDS.

fields.name: total dissolved solids (TDS) measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value from a total dissolved solids (TDS) test.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured TDS.

fields.name: total dissolved solids (TDS) measurement value

fields.description: The method used to measure total nitrogen (TN).

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure TN.

fields.name: total nitrogen (TN) measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of total nitrogen (TN).

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured TN.

fields.name: total nitrogen (TN) measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of total nitrogen (TN).

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured TN.

fields.name: total nitrogen (TN) measurement value

fields.description: The method used to measure total phosphorus (TP).

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure TP.

fields.name: total phosphorus (TP) measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of total phosphorus (TP).

meta.examples: milligrams orthophosphate as phosphorus per liter (mg PO4-P/L)
meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured TP.

fields.name: total phosphorus (TP) measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of total phosphorus (TP).

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured TP.

fields.name: total phosphorus (TP) measurement value

fields.description: The method used to measure total solids (TS).

meta.examples: Gravimetric method by oven drying, then weighing
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure TS.

fields.name: total solids (TS) measurement method

fields.description: The units associated with a value from a total solids (TS) test.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured TS.

fields.name: total solids (TS) measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value from a total solids (TS) test.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured TS.

fields.name: total solids (TS) measurement value

fields.description: The method used to measure total suspended solids (TSS).

meta.examples: Vacuum filter through a 2-micron filter, then oven-dried and weighed sample
meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure TSS.

fields.name: total suspended solids (TSS) measurement method

fields.description: The units associated with a value from a total suspended solids (TSS) test.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured TSS.

fields.name: total suspended solids (TSS) measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value from a total suspended solids (TSS) test.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured TSS.

fields.name: total suspended solids (TSS) measurement value

fields.description: The process used to measure turbidity.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure turbidity.

fields.name: turbidity measurement method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of turbidity.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured turbidity by selecting a value from the pick list.

fields.name: turbidity measurement unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of turbidity.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured turbidity.

fields.name: turbidity measurement value

fields.description: A gene, virus, bacteria, or substance used to measure the sanitary quality of water in regards to urinary contamination.

meta.notes: If a urinary contamination indicator was measured, select it from the picklist.

fields.name: urinary contamination indicator

fields.description: The method used to measure urinary contamination.

meta.notes: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure urinary contamination.

fields.name: urinary contamination method

fields.description: The units of a measurement of urinary contamination.

meta.notes: Provide the units of the measured urinary contamination.

fields.name: urinary contamination unit

fields.description: The numerical value of a measurement of urinary contamination.

meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the measured urinary contamination.

fields.name: urinary contamination value

fields.description: The type or classification of a wastewater system e.g. sanitary sewer, combined sewer

meta.notes: Provide the classification of the wastewater system by selecting from the provided pick list.

fields.name: wastewater system type

fields.description: The unit describing the number of humans per geographical area in a water catchment.

meta.displayName: water catchment area human population density unit
meta.notes: Provide the unit of the population density in the catchement area.

fields.name: water catchment area human population density unit

fields: water catchment area human population density value

fields.description: The numerical value describing the number of humans per geographical area in a water catchment.

meta.displayName: water catchment area human population density value
meta.notes: Provide the numerical value of the population density in the catchement area.

fields.name: water catchment area human population density value

fields: water catchment area human population density unit

fields.description: The method by which a water catchment 's human population size was measured or estimated

meta.displayName: water catchment area human population measurement method
meta.examples: population of jurisdiction encompassing the wastewater service area
meta.notes: Provide a brief description of how catchment population size was measured or estimated.

fields.name: water catchment area human population measurement method

fields: water catchment area human population measurement value

fields.description: The numerical value of the human population measurement that contributes to the composition of water in a catchment area.

meta.displayName: water catchment area human population measurement value
meta.notes: Where known, provide the numerical value of population size, i.e. the number of people.

fields.name: water catchment area human population measurement value

fields: water catchment area human population measurement method

fields.description: The human population range of the water catchment that contributes effluent to a wastewater site.

meta.displayName: water catchment area human population range
meta.notes: Where catchment population is not well known, provide an estimation of population size by selecting a value from the picklist.

fields.name: water catchment area human population range

fields.description: The availability status of a shapefile descriping the catchment contributing to a watershed.

meta.notes: Select a value from the picklist to describe whether or not a watershed shapefile would be available upon request.

fields.name: watershed shapefile availability

fields.description: The name of the watershed shapefile.

meta.notes: Provide the shapefile filename corresponding to the watershed from which the sample was taken. If there are multiple files associated with the watershed, provide all names separated by commas.

fields.name: watershed shapefile filename

schemas.name: sample
